Posts.Content: I have just finished 20 sessions, 15 for the whole right breast and 5 on the area where the lump was. I used a cream called My Trusty that was developed by Salisbury Hospital (skin specialist), it contains all natural ingredients and a bonus for me that it's not tested on animals. Yes I did get sore a little which only lasted a few days but touch wood my skin is in good condition, apply twice a day.
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy finished

Posts.Content: Leolady 56 Thank you for replying to my post, I suppose I just need time, I have a habit of running before I can walk. I will take a look at the chemo threads. Cycling girl
Posts.Title: How to deal with chemo explosion

Posts.Content: Hi Cathy Thanks for those words of wisdom, especially the baked bean trick, however that could get messy I just need to concentrate on me and I need to learn to slow down, that will be the hard task. Cycling girl
Posts.Title: How to deal with chemo explosion

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed with breast cancer her2 positive on 24 July and started chemo on 6 August, I had kept myself busy up to then. It's been a week since first session, however feels longer. Ive been very lucky that I have never been really ill and always strong , but this chemo I feel is wrecking me and my personality.  How do you keep moving forward, I have another 5 sessions every 3 weeks.
Posts.Title: How to deal with chemo explosion
